      • setCredential

        public void setCredential(String clusterName,
                          String alias,
                          Credential credential,
                          CredentialStoreType credentialStoreType)
                   throws org.apache.ambari.server.AmbariException
        Adds a new credential to either the persistent or the temporary CredentialStore

        The supplied key will be converted into UTF-8 bytes before being stored.

        The alias name will be canonicalized as follows:

        • if a cluster name is supplied, then "cluster.name." will be prepended to it
        • the characters will converted to all lowercase
        Only a single instance of the named credential will be stored, therefore if a credential with alias ALIAS1 is stored in the persisted CredentialStore and a call is made to store a credentials with alias ALIAS1 into the temporary CredentialStore, the instance in the persisted CredentialStore will be removed.
        Specified by:
        setCredential in interface CredentialStoreService
        Parameters:
        clusterName - the name of the cluster this credential is related to
        alias - a string declaring the alias (or name) of the credential
        credential - the credential value to store
        credentialStoreType - a CredentialStoreType indicating which credential store facility to use
        Throws:
        org.apache.ambari.server.AmbariException

      • canonicalizeAlias

        public static String canonicalizeAlias(String clusterName,
                                       String alias)
        Canonicalizes an alias name by making sure that is contains the prefix indicating what cluster it belongs to. This helps to reduce collisions of alias between clusters pointing to the same keystore files.

        Each alias is expected to have a prefix of cluster.:clusterName., and the combination is to be converted to have all lowercase characters. For example if the alias was "external.DB" and the cluster name is "c1", then the canonicalized alias name would be "cluster.c1.external.db".

        Parameters:
        clusterName - the name of the cluster
        alias - a string declaring the alias (or name) of the credential
        Returns:
        a ccanonicalized alias name

      • decanonicalizeAlias

        public static String decanonicalizeAlias(String clusterName,
                                         String canonicaizedAlias)
        Removes the prefix (if exists) from the front of a canonicalized alias
        Parameters:
        clusterName - the name the name of the cluster
        canonicaizedAlias - the canonicalized alias to process
        Returns:
        an alias name
